channel.description: Pretending to be mad helped me not to be really mad, and playing instead of shouting helped her get ready faster! Play serves our incredible—almost bottomless—need for attachment and affection and closeness. Play to recover from emotional distress. Transform, through play, disconnection into connection. They may be annoying, obnoxious, or downright infuriating as they try desperately to signal us that they need more connection. These situations call for creating more playtime, not doling out punishment or leaving the lonely child all alone.
